name: Disk Image File
summary: An ISO file is a disk image that contains an exact duplicate of data from a source disk, such as an optical disc or hard drive. Computer users typically use ISO files to duplicate CD, DVD, or Blu-ray discs for sharing or backup purposes or download ISO files from a website to install software on a computer (e.g., downloading and installing the Windows 11 operating system). Additionally, users can mount ISO files, extract files from ISO files, and burn ISO files to optical discs.
